bwwExcerpt: I'd love to herald this sweet, well-meaning show as the big, bombastic return of musical theatre to the West End. It has some great numbers and some stand-out performances (Marisha Wallace, given a standing ovation on press night, needs her own show, stat), but it sometimes feels functional and the plot is dated. It all feels a bit 'white people solve racism' - not to mention the eyebrow-raising lyric "now I've tasted chocolate and I'm never going back" - and Tracy's trajectory is too neat and t
